title: Why do mid season class updates exist?
body: Is it to prevent the game from becoming stale? Because right now I feel like the state of balance is pretty good. I fear that this update will shake everything up.

replies.body: they're pretty good changes so far

> [{quoted}](name=xWaters,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JO5FAYs6,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-04-07T23:47:27.599+0000)
>
> Is it to prevent the game from becoming stale? Because right now I feel like the state of balance is pretty good. I fear that this update will shake everything up.

It's mostly this but also because they want to do work on older champions to make their kits more cohesive while carving out an identity for each champion. I'd get used to it if I were you because I'm pretty sure they said they intend on eventually hitting every class with a rework.
I just hate that items need to be changed. That's what I have a hard time dealing with.

> [{quoted}](name=xWaters,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JO5FAYs6,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-04-08T00:34:57.862+0000)
>
> I just hate that items need to be changed. That's what I have a hard time dealing with.

I'd like to give you a reassuring pat on the back and tell you "Don't worry, cutie. The Riot balance team knows what they're doing". But if I did that, I'd be lying to you.
So the game doesn't remain in limbo for a whole years time.
